gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
Dataset of administrative boundaries on country level
This dataset contains 2 feature classes (regions, boundaries) per scale level and there are 6 different scale levels (100K, 1M, 3M, 10M, 20M and 60M). In addition to those 12 feature classes, there is an additional scale independent feature class for the labels. The extent of the feature classes covers the entire world.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The countries data set is used mainly for mapping purposes.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Directive 20007/.../EC/ of the European parliament and of the Council of establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: The datasets have been created for cartographic purposes.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes should be present

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes are present

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The integrity and cardinality of the relationships (conceptual and implemented) was checked by enforcing primary and foreign key integrity constraints in Oracle. The constraints referencing coded value domain tables were a test of domain consistency.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Errors will show during creation of integrity constraints in Oracle. Constraints will not be applicable in case of violations to the consistency.

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No errors occurred, so the integrity of all primary and foreign keys was confirmed. All the values of each coded value attribute are compliant to the domains (except for any NULL values). The cardinality can only be confirmed where it is strict enough for this test to detect errors.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of CNTR region feature class for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR regions should not overlap each other

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No topology errors identified, so no overlapping regions.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of CNTR boundary feature class for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR boundaries must not have dangles, must not have dangles, must not overlap, must not self-overlap, must not self-intersect, must not intersect or touch interior and must be singlepart

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real topology errors identified. See QC report.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency between CNTR regions and CNTR boundaries for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_BN_2006: Must be covered by boundary of CNTR_RG_2006

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Alignment between datasets - CNTR-COMM at 100K scale

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_BN_100K_2006 Boundary must be covered by COMM_BN_2006 where CNTR participate in COMM_2006

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: All errors found were due to the unequal extent (cntr --> world and comm --> EU27, EFTA, MD and MD)

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Alignment between datasets - CNTR-NUTS at all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_BN_2006 Boundary must be covered by NUTS_BN_2006 where CNTR participate in NUTS_2006

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: All errors found were due to the unequal extent (cntr --> world and nuts --> EU27, EFTA, CC)

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_LB_2006: Must be properly inside a polygon in CNTR_RG_100K_2006 with the same CNTR_ID

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real errors found, all indicated labels outside a region belonged to archipelagos

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: This dataset (together with the other datasets: NUTS_2006, COMM_2006 and COAS_2006) is based on geometry of EBM v2.0. of EuroGeographics on commune level with a resolution of 30m (scale 1:100.000) enriched with some other datasources like Gaul 2006 country data, Scole, NSI of TR, Digital Chart of the World and ArcWorld data. This resulted in a common repository of geometry of which the different datasets were derived. The different scale levels were derived of generalisations of the common repository on 100K scale. This means that within each scale level the feature classes of all these datasets: COMM_2006, NUTS_2006, CNTR_2006 and COAS_2006, are fully coherent and compliant. Each scale level in the CNTR_2006 dataset consists of 2 feature classes (regions and boundaries) The boundaries and regions are related to each other through a relationship table. In addition to the region and boundary feature classes there is also 1 label feature class which is scale independent. For each CNTR in the region feature class there is exactly 1 label .

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: (i) Eurogeographics EBM v2.0. and SCOLE data (scale 1:100K) (ii) GAUL 2006 country level data (iii) NSI of TR for the Turkish features (iv) Digital Chart of the World (Kaliningrad) (v) ArcWorld Data (Aral Sea, Kaspian Sea, some other borders)
